column4: any plans to "support" (homologate, I don't know how to call the fact of paying them to 'audit' the system) oracle and progress databases in ubuntu, just like RHEL, suse, etc?
i miss that a lot in ubuntu
where I sit, your comment related to missing ubuntu being bloated and slow with old, buggy apps. I certainly 'miss' that too ;)
I know, I phrased it in a clumsy kind of way. The way the lines scrolled by just happened to place your comment just below stodge's FC2 comment :)

I would think that you could send a polite e-mail to canonical with your inquiry. Afaik, #ubuntu doesn't represent canonical, it's just a friendly place for users (and occasionally devs as well) to talk about ubuntu
